description: ['Reds Meadow Road, which provides vehicle access to Devils Postpile National Monument, will temporarily close due to an incoming storm by 6 pm on Friday, November 1.', 'Reds Meadow Road & shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will be closed for construction from Sundays at 11 pm through Saturdays at 7 am during the summer 2024 season.']

title: ['Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide', 'Road Open To: Mile 3 (Park Headquarters)']
description: ['Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.', 'The Denali Park Road is currently open to Mile 3, Park Headquarters. Snowy conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.']

title: ['Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season']
description: ['Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles for through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed at Colorado River Trailhead on the west side of the park and at Rainbow Curve on the east side.']

title: ['Biscuit Basin closed for the remainder of year due to hydrothermal explosion', 'Vehicle entrance reservation not needed', 'Most Park Roads Closing to Regular Vehicles November 1']
description: ['The parking lot and boardwalks at Biscuit Basin, located north of Old Faithful, are closed for the remainder of the year due to a hydrothermal explosion that occurred July 23. The Grand Loop Road remains open to vehicles.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.', 'The last day to enjoy most of the park in a regular vehicle is October 31. Most roads will open to guided oversnow tours on December 15. The road between the North and Northeast entrances is the only road open year-round to regular vehicles.']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

title: ['Hurricane Ridge Road Status - Thursday, Oct. 31th 8:15 am', 'Temporary bridge removal on North Shore Quinault Rd, closing Quinault Loop Drive', '"Sneaker Waves" and Other Risks from Atmospheric River this week']
description: ['Hurricane Ridge Road will remain closed today due to snow. It is unlikely that the road will be open within the next week, but updates will be posted daily by 9:00 am.', 'The temporary bridge on the North Shore Quinault Road will be removed on Wednesday, October 23rd, and will remain removed through the winter. This will split the Quinault Loop Drive. To access the Graves Creek area, take South Shore Road.', 'Sneaker waves can catch beachgoers by surprise, sometimes with deadly results. Rain and winds throughout the Peninsula may also cause rising rivers, fallen trees, and unexpected road closures. Please visit with caution and carry emergency supplies.']

title: ['Trail at Meriams Corner Headed East is Closed for Trail Work', 'Temporary Trail Closure Shadyside Road (east) to Brooks Village to Captain Smith House']
description: ["Beginning Tuesday October 22, the Battle Road Trail from Meriam's Corner heading east will be closed for trail improvement work. Please do not enter the closure. The closure will last several weeks.", 'Trail improvement work is taking place between Shadyside Road east between Brooks Village Parking Lot and Captain William Smith House. The Brooks Village parking lot is closed to the public as construction materials are staged in the lot.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ['There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['Mile Creek Road Realignment', 'Flooding on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Construction to realign a portion of Mile Creek Road and construct a new bridge over Grand Portage Creek continues. Beginning Tuesday September 3, the public should expect traffic control flagging and temporary delays.', 'Increased rain and beaver dam activity this year flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail. Please use caution as you pass through the water. Park staff is in the process of determining a drier route.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles']
description: ['The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Echo Park Road HC4WD and Yampa Bench Road may be Impassable']
description: ['Due to weather conditions, the Echo Park Road requires high-clearance 4-wheel drive. The Yampa Bench Road is not recommended and may be impassable.']

title: ['Temporary road closures due to construction until November 11th.']
description: ['Portions of roads will be closed one at a time for up to a full day. Visitors may use alternate roads to reach their destination but should expect to encounter detours and traffic delays.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Trail Connection Between Ben Johnson Trail and Dipsea closed Monday-Thursday until January 2025', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['Our trail crew will be working to rebuild switchbacks above the Stapelveldt junction. The trail is expected to be open most Fridays and weekends. Alternate routes are available on surrounding trails. Click more (link) for map.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project', 'Visitor Center Parking Lot Construction']
description: ['The Scenic Drive is closed from just south of the campground to Capitol Gorge for construction. Expect heavy truck traffic. Most of the park remains accessible. The road is currently expected to reopen mid-November.', 'The visitor center parking lot is being expanded and reconfigured. It is partially closed to facilitate work. Expect flaggers, congestion, and a full lot. Look for signs to alternate parking for vehicles over 20 feet.']

title: ['Campground & Road Closures effective 11/01/2024']
description: ['Baker Creek Campground, Grey Cliffs Campground, Snake Creek Road (including primitive campsites), and Strawberry Creek Road will be closing for the winter on the morning of 11/01/2024. Lower Lehman Creek Campground remains open for the winter.']

title: ['Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd', 'Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.', 'Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

title: ['Green River Ferry Status']
description: ['The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['November Hike and Bike Day: Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway Closed', 'Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway: Hike and Bike Day']
description: ['On November 2, Newton B. Drury Parkway will be closed to all vehicle traffic for the Hike and Bike Day event. The parkway will close Friday night and reopen to vehicles Sunday afternoon.', 'The Newton B. Drury Parkway is closed to vehicles on the first Saturday of each month from October to May for Hike and Bike Day. The parkway closes on the Friday night before the event and reopens Sunday afternoon.']

title: ['Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

title: ['Fire in Surrounding National Forests', 'Construction Closures at LSR Preserve and Death Canyon']
description: ['Smokey conditions and low air quality exist in the park. Fire in surrounding national forests may cause road closures and delays, use WY511 to stay informed. Stay safe and be cautious.', 'Construction will close the Laurance S. Rockefeller Preserve entrance road and parking area on September 23 and Death Canyon Road and Trailhead on October 1. Access Phelps Lake and Death Canyon via the Valley Trail network. Planned to open for winter rec.']

title: ['Wilderness Road Trail closed between Gap Cave and Tennessee Road Trail', 'Storm Damage Hazards, Closures, and Updated Information']
description: ['Due to work on a bridge, the Wilderness Road trail is closed between Gap Cave and the Tennessee Road Trail', 'Damage from Hurricane Helene has created hazardous conditions and caused impacts to park roads, trails, and programs. Go to our Alerts & Conditions page for important safety and closure updates.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Station Road Bridge Trailhead parking lot', 'Riverview Road south of Boston Mill Visitor Center']
description: ['Station Road Bridge Trailhead parking lot is closed, 7 am Monday, October 28–5 pm Friday, November 8 for paving and drainage improvement. The connector trail from Brecksville Reservation and the restrooms will remain open.', "Starting Tuesday, October 22 Riverview Road will be closed just south of Boston for 60 days for bridge repairs. Visit the Summit County Engineer's website for a map of the detour route, which involves State Route 303, Black Road, and Boston Mills Road."]

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season from Avalanche Creek to Jackson Glacier Overlook. Hiker-biker access beyond these points is permitted. Winter weather conditions may change the location of these closures at any time.']

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['Road Closure for Rim Rock Run Sunday November 3, 2024']
description: ['From 7am to about 1:30pm during the Rim Rock Marathon, a closure of the west-bound lane throughout the entire monument will provide a safe route for runners. East-bound traffic will not be affected; please drive slowly and stay alert for runners.']

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Parson Branch Road', 'Single-lane closures on Newfound Gap Road near Gatlinburg', 'Upcoming closure of Clingmans Dome Road the mornings of September 10, 12 and 16', 'Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']
description: ['Parson Branch Road is closed due to potential fire danger.', 'Construction on Newfound Gap Road between Gatlinburg and Park HQ. Expect delays during lane closures and drive safely in work zones.', 'To facilitate special educational programs for students at schools in the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians community, the road will be closed at midnight the night before each event and will re-open at 1 p.m.', 'Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Parson Branch Road closed', 'id': 'BA75362D-42A7-4F58-9C00-67E4233F2D15', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Single-lane closures on Newfound Gap Road', 'id': 'DEC18631-D9BE-4C60-A06E-D421FF73EE40', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], [], [], []]

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project', 'Visitor Center Parking Lot Construction']
description: ['Effective May 20, 2024, the Scenic Drive is closed from just south of the campground to Capitol Gorge. Expect heavy truck traffic. Most of the park remains accessible. The road is currently expected to reopen at the end of October.', 'The visitor center parking lot is being expanded and reconfigured. It will be partially closed to facilitate work starting the week of September 9. Expect flaggers, congestion, and a full lot. Look for signs to alternate parking for vehicles over 20 feet.']

park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['Black Canyon South Rim Wilderness Permits', 'Expanded Opening of U.S. Highway 50 Middle Bridge', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']
description: ['Day-of-hike permitting for South Rim routes is in effect for the off-season, starting Friday, September 13, 2024. Obtain permits at the South Rim Visitor Center. Permits required for Gunnison, Tomichi, and Warner routes; daily limits apply.', 'Starting Friday, Aug. 30, travel over the U.S. Highway 50 Middle Bridge will be open from 6:30 am to 7 pm daily for alternating one-way traffic. Travel is still limited to lighter vehicles. Check the CDOT website for details.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-October 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the South Rim Visitor Center. Drive with caution. More road work in 2025.']

title: ['Expect 15-minute delays on the Glacier Point Road starting on September 4']
description: ['Expect 15-minute delays from 6 am to 8 pm, Mondays through Fridays, on Glacier Point Road from Bridalveil Creek Bridge to Glacier Point. Work will start on September 4 and last about two weeks.']

title: ['Steel Creek Phone Lines Offline', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ["Steel Creek's phone lines are down due to road construction on Steel Creek Road. Please call Tyler Bend Visitor Center at 870-439-2502 for park information.", 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['Extreme Summer Heat can be Fatal', 'Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Summer temps in the preserve can exceed 120 degrees. Hiking in the middle of the day and or dealing with a vehicle breakdown on a remote road can quickly become a life-threatening emergency. Plan and prepare with water, shade, and stay with your vehicle.', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Hart Mine Road', 'id': '09EAF34E-7380-4129-A04E-4F3AF013E1BD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ivanpah Low Water Crossing Repair', 'id': 'DEC80F3F-5E36-4E09-9DA3-1B74F93163D1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road']
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Red Gate Fire Road', 'id': 'B7AF53DA-FA44-4743-B579-FF81CB68EE33', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', 'id': 'C509E46A-FE91-4AE4-9D13-9ECFEFC2F89D', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['East Rim Drive Closed to Motorized Vehicles on September 7th and 14th for Ride the Rim', 'East Rim Drive CLOSED from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook for Road Construction', 'Mount Scott Trail is Currently CLOSED Due to Unsafe Conditions']
description: ['The 10th annual Ride the Rim event will be happening on Saturdays 9/7 and 9/14. The East Rim Drive will close for the event each weekend on Friday evening at 7:00 PM and will reopen on Saturday afternoon at 4:00 PM. North Entrance Road is open.', 'Due to a major road construction project, the road from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook is CLOSED. The road to Cloudcap is also closed.', 'Major road construction on the East Rim Drive near Mount Scott makes it unsafe to hike or bike to the trailhead on the closed road. Once construction moves beyond that area later in the summer, the trailhead will reopen.']

title: ['MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction']
description: ['Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for repaving and infrastructure repair. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for Laurel Fork Bridge replacement. Detour in place from MP 248 (NC 18) to MP 249 (Northwest Trading Post).', 'Road closed to all activity for replacement of 3 bridges. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'id': '91C85167-D35D-491B-AA25-5C0126ABCB3A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'id': 'D0E50AD5-402C-449A-851F-72942841B9F8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'id': '9C351538-9DC3-4586-8B55-2F592C9D3AB8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'id': 'F0074D0C-85BC-4CE1-9661-CADF62BB4AA5', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'id': 'AB5E8A6A-055C-4A2C-A11F-89B06AB41160', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction', 'id': 'E185319B-0775-4E70-871E-BE6E3765BB13', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blri/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['CR675 Culvert Replacement', 'Sleeping Bear Point Road Construction']
description: ['Replacement of culvert on County Road 675 has started. Location of replacement is 0.25 miles West of S Westman Rd. S Dunns Farm Rd traffic will be rerouted. Kayakers, plan to paddle back upstream if launching at Fisher Road or put in North of CR 675.', "The road and trailhead access will remain open, but with diminished capacity. It's recommended visitors use the Maritime Museum for additional parking, especially those pulling trailers or larger vehicles. Completion is expected in 3 weeks."]
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'County Road 675 Culvert Replacement', 'id': 'A90AAAF0-13D6-47FF-86A8-269EB4929DEA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/slbe/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Sleeping Bear Point Road construction', 'id': '1C0A8A2B-79CA-46B1-B9E9-25E76AD82C74', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/slbe/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
title: ['No Potable Water Available at Rivers Bend Group Campground', 'Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Anyone with reservations for the campground should bring their own water or stop at Millbrook Village up the road to fill their reserves. The water spigot is in the picnic area near the bathroom building.', 'Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest is closed for a pavement rehabilitation project. No pedestrian, bicycle, or vehicle traffic is permitted in the closed area. Please see news releases for more information.']

title: ['Vehicle entrance reservation not needed', 'Biscuit Basin closed for the remainder of summer due to hydrothermal explosion']
description: ['Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.', 'The parking lot and boardwalks at Biscuit Basin, located north of Old Faithful, are closed for the remainder of the summer due to a hydrothermal explosion that occurred July 23. The Grand Loop Road remains open to vehicles.']

title: ['County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion']
description: ['Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road is Open for the Season']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is fully open for the 2024 summer season. The road may now be accessed by motorized vehicles over Logan Pass from both the West Glacier and St. Mary entrances.']

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['Great Meadow Loop and village connector trails closed along Great Meadow Drive', 'Some Streets in Downtown Bar Harbor Closed for Construction Through Summer']
description: ['The trail crew is removing old road asphalt with heavy equipment. Village connectors along Cromwell Harbor Road also are closed to improve safety and accessibility. Hikers can walk along the roadway to access trails into the Sieur de Monts area.', 'To avoid traffic congestion, visitors should access Sand Beach via the Park Loop Road by following signs from the park’s Hulls Cove entrance on Route 3 (Eden Street) or Cadillac Mountain entrance on Route 233 (Eagle Lake Road) in Bar Harbor.']

title: ['Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024']
description: ['Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.']

title: ['Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd', 'Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.', 'Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

title: ['Temporary Road Closures of Echo Park and Yampa Bench Roads']
description: ['The unpaved Echo Park and Yampa Bench roads are temporarily closed because of multiple washouts after a rain event on August 25. They are being assessed for repairs. No estimated date for reopening at this time.']

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']
description: ["Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River."]

title: ['Bridge out on Gibson Gap Trail', 'Trail Segment Closure']
description: ['Recent storms have washed out the bridge over Station Creek on the Gibson Gap trail. Horses may continue on the trail, but hikers will need to use an alternate route. To get reach the Gibson Gap Trail, hikers should use Greenleaf Nature trail to Honey Tre', 'Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for a project to replace the bridge across Gap Creek.']

title: ['Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping']
description: ['Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The Service Road/Trail toward the lighthouse are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

park: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ['Construction']
description: ['Partial closure of Education Center parking lot due to ongoing construction. No capacity for oversized vehicles (busses, trucks with trailer/camper, long RVs). Please use Heritage Center and Freeman School lots.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2024']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road & shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will be closed for construction from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 9 am (except holidays) during the summer 2024 season. The road also closes Fridays starting September 15.']

title: ['Partial Miles Creston Road Closure begins on July 10, 2024', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Lincoln County will be closing a portion of Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road beginning July 10, 2024, through December 1, 2024. If you are accessing Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, or Seven Bays you may need to find an alternate route.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

park: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Tuzigoot National Monument. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

title: ['Future Construction and Road Closure']
description: ['On November 1, Cliff Palace Loop Road (including access to Soda Canyon Overlook Trail) will close for construction. Views of Cliff Palace are available from Sun Temple on the Mesa Top Loop. Follow the link to the park map.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

park: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument
title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']

park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Katahdin View Loop Road Detour September 16-18', 'Katahdin View Overlook and Loop Road Miles 6-9 Closed Starting September 9', 'Impassable Washout on Seboeis Connector Road']
description: ['Miles 0-5 on the Katahdin View Loop Road will be closed Monday, September 16 through Wednesday, September 18 for a bridge replacement near mile 0. Traffic will be rerouted via Stacyville Road and Kelloch Mountain Road to join the Loop Road near mile 5.', 'Starting Monday, September 9, the Katahdin View Overlook at mile 6.4 on the Loop Road will be closed for a rehabilitation project through summer 2025. The Loop Road will be closed from mile 6 to mile 9 and traffic will be rerouted on the Rocky Pond Road.', 'There is an impassable washout on the Seboeis Connector Road (46.07214,-68.63190) within the Seboeis Parcel of Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument.']

title: ['Exit Ramp 254 on I-80 Closed']
description: ['Exit ramp 254 on I-80 is closed due to road construction. To reach Herbert Hoover National Historic Site from I-80, use exit ramp 249 and take Herbert Hoover Hwy NE. Please visit Iowa 511 for more information on road conditions.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']
description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

title: ['Detour Northbound on Great River Road Through Town of McGregor']
description: ['Vehicles towing trailers, campers, or semi trucks must turn onto Clayton Rd. towards Garnavillo, then onto Hwy 52 North, then right onto Hwy 18 in Marquette, then left onto Hwy 76 for Effigy Mounds National Monument. Smaller vehicles not affected.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['CENTRAL VA – PARKING LOT CLOSURE– ROUTE 311/MCAFEE KNOB']
description: ['McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.']

title: ['Expanded Opening of U.S. Highway 50 Middle Bridge']
description: ['Starting Friday, Aug. 30, travel over the U.S. Highway 50 Middle Bridge will be open from 6:30 am to 7 pm daily for alternating one-way traffic. Travel is still limited to lighter vehicles. Check the CDOT website for details.']

title: ['State Route 20 Closure', 'Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed', 'State Route 20 Information', 'Cascade River Road Closure', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['From 6 am Monday, Sept 9, until 6 am Friday, Sept 13, a four-day closure of State Route 20 will be in place at milepost 105 near Ranger Station Road. A detour will direct traffic along SR 530, Rockport Cascade Road, and Cascade River Road in Marblemount.', 'The gate at Hozomeen remains closed to vehicle access from Canada. Winnebago Flats and the upper Hozomeen campgrounds will remain closed. For more information visit the news release on summer operations.', 'As of Aug. 22, State Route 20 is open for travel. There is a 35 mph reduced advisory speed zone from milepost 150-154. Beginning Monday August 26 there will be flagger-controlled traffic with pilot car. For more information visit the WSDOT real time map.', 'Cascade River Road is closed at MP 8 (Marble Creek) due to the Pincer Two Fire. There is no access to the park beyond the closure.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Phleger Estate Miramontes Trail Closed for Public Safety January 2022 Until Trail is Replaced', 'Section of Old San Pedro Mountain Road at Rancho Corral de Tierra closed starting August 19, 2024', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. Until construction of a re-route is complete, the trail will be closed.', 'The road will be closed Monday through Thursday, 8AM-4PM, from the trailhead in the south to the junction with Farallon Trail. A crew will be repairing a culvert along the road. Work is expected to complete by mid-September.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['277N Campground Closed to Tentatively Reopen October 1']
description: ['Due to resource theft and damage from unauthorized off-road travel in and around the campground, the 277N Campground is closed. It is expected to reopen October 1, 2024.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

park: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

title: ['Fire in Surrounding National Forests']
description: ['Fire in surrounding national forests may cause road closures and delays, use WY511 to stay informed. Smokey conditions and low air quality exist in the park. Stay safe and be cautious.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Montezuma Castle National Monument and its Sub-Unit Montezuma Well. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Fire Ban in Effect']
description: ['Fire Ban in Effect as of July 24th, 2024, at 2 PM. No open fires with wood/charcoal are permitted in the park. Gas/Propane stoves are permitted. Smoking allowed only in Vehicles or Paved Parking Lots. No Fireworks Allowed at all times. 36 CFR 1.5(a)(1).']

title: ['AQUA Project to Install New Water Main Along Route 23', 'County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['Aqua project to install a new water main along route 23 will replace an outdated main. No impact to visitors at HQ or accessing trails - there will be some detours near the road, but the area will still be passable. Please stay out of worksite.', 'County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Temporary Closure of Elephant Hill 4WD Road at SOB Hill', 'Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays August through September', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ['Elephant Hill 4WD road in Needles district is temporarily closed past SOB Hill due to damage related to recent flooding. Visitors with permits may still access the road up to that point but must turn around there and exit. Hikers are permitted access.', 'Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles, bikes, & hikers.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

park: Lewis and Clark National Historical Park
title: ['South Fort Clatsop Road Closure']
description: ['Crews will be replacing a culvert on Fort Clatsop Road at milepost 2.07. The road will be closed to all Traffic at milepost 2.07 (Near Netul Landing) during this time. The Fort Clatsop Visitor Center is accessible from alternate 101.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Main Road Status']
description: ['The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['River Closure, Portage at Fitzwater Road']
description: ['River-wide closure near river mile 17 due to bridge construction. Barrier cables with buoys extend across the river. Follow signs to portage upstream of the Fitzwater Road bridge. Exit on the west side of the river (river left), relaunch on the east side.']

title: ['Visit Safely in the Summer', 'Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ['Summer season brings hot temperatures and monsoons. Bring water, snacks, and sun protection for your visit. Check weather conditions before hiking. Severe lighting and flash floods can occur. When driving in the area, avoid flooded roadways.', 'There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['Plum Orchard Loop road potentially closed 9/9 - 9/13']
description: ['Electrical work will be done on Plum Orchard Loop road from 9/9-9/13. Traffic will be rerouted as needed during this time. Heed all closures for safety. Plum Orchard will be open for tours during this time.']

title: ['Trail closure for pipeline restoration project']
description: ['The VC09/South Valle Toledo/Posos Trail from the Valle Toledo parking area to the eastern park boundary is closed for restoration. The NPS is working on a trail reroute for the 2025 season and will provide details early next year.']

title: ['Denali Park Road Information', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 15 (Savage River) for personal vehicles. Vehicle travel beyond Savage River in summer is mainly limited to transit and tour buses.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is rutted and may be muddy in spots from monsoon rains. A four-wheel drive, high clearance vehicle is recommended.']

title: ['Parking Lot and Surrounding Area Closed for Construction August 26 through September 27.']
description: ["The Park's parking lot, access road, and outdoor classroom will be closed due to construction safety. Visitors can access the Visitor Center via walking the trails through Riverview Point Preserve located next door. Construction begins Monday August 26."]

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark', 'Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense.", 'Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.']

title: ['Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

title: ['Partial Road Closure Saturday September 14']
description: ['1,600 bicyclists will be riding the Tour of the Moon event east to west on Rim Rock Drive 9/14/24. The west-bound lane will close from the east (Grand Junction) entrance to DS Road from 7:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m. Drive west to east to avoid closure or delay.']

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

title: ['Limited parking at Summerland Trailhead through October 9, including weekends.', 'Your GPS May Be Wrong']
description: ['Due to construction around Fryingpan Creek Bridge, parking at the Summerland Trailhead along the White River Road is very limited. Additional parking available at the Wonderland Trail connection approx. 1 mile east from trailhead. No RV/oversize parking.', 'There are five entrances to the park. GPS may take you to the wrong entrance or attempt to follow the most direct route, which could lead to closed gates. It can take hours to reroute to the correct entrance. Check directions & maps, not just your GPS.']

title: ['Camp only in campgrounds']
description: ['If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.']

title: ['Paces Mill Closed for Rehabilitation', 'Trails at Johnson Ferry North Closed Sept 7 - Oct 9']
description: ['Paces Mill will be closed from mid-September 2024 - May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US41 will be open with very limited vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!', 'Trails will be closed for entrance from Johnson Ferry North for 4 weeks beginning September 9, 2024, to allow for infrastructure work. The parking lot, restrooms, and boat ramp will remain open. Trails may still be accessed from Hyde Farm Road.']

title: ['Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

title: ['Caution Advised for Travel on Willow Springs or Salt Valley Roads']
description: ['After recent rainfall, take extra caution driving on the unpaved Willow Springs Road and Salt Valley Road. Washed out areas currently require high clearance and 4WD. Conditions may improve as the road surfaces dry out.']

title: ['Green River Ferry Status', 'Green River Ferry Closed Due to Low Water Conditions']
description: ['The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed.', "The Green River Ferry is closed to all traffic due to low water conditions. For the most up-to-date information on the ferry's status, please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at 270-758-2166 or follow Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry X/Twitter feed."]

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['VISITOR CENTER CLOSURE 9/5/24']
description: ['The visitor center at Chaco Culture National Historical Park will be closed until 3:30pm on Thursday, Sept 5th, for an all-employees meeting. The loop road will remain open from 7:00am-9:00pm during the closure. Restrooms will also be open.']

title: ['Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road']
description: ['The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.']

title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Portions of Sequoia National Park Closed in the South Fork Kaweah Drainage Due to Wildfire Activity']
description: ['The portion of South Fork Road in Sequoia National Park and trails accessed from the road, including the Lady Bug and Garfield Grove Trails, are closed until further notice due to the proximity of the Coffee Pot Fire.']

title: ['Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation', 'National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.', 'Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Mile Creek Road Realignment', 'Flooding on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Construction to realign a portion of Mile Creek Road and construct a new bridge over Grand Portage Creek continues. Beginning Tuesday September 3, the public should expect traffic control flagging and temporary delays.', 'Increased rain and beaver dam activity this year flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail. Please use caution as you pass through the water. Park staff is in the process of determining a drier route.']

title: ['Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

title: ['2nd Street Festival']
description: ['The 2nd Street Festival, Oct. 5-6, 2024, will result in numerous road closures around the site. We will staff a tent at 2nd and Leigh St. and offer open house tours from 2-4 p.m. both days. See event website for more information']

title: ['RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles - Low Overhead Clearance']
description: ['Drivers of RVs, vehicles towing trailers, and other high overhead clearance vehicles, should use caution when entering the park due to overhead hazards near the park entrance.']

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['North Entrance Temporary Closure Continues', 'East Rim Drive CLOSED from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook for Road Construction', 'Mount Scott Trail is Currently CLOSED Due to Unsafe Conditions']
description: ['The North Entrance to Crater Lake National Park remains temporarily CLOSED to allow firefighters on the Middle Fork Fire to prepare control lines along the North Entrance Road. Reopening date is not known at this time.', 'Due to a major road construction project, the road from Skell Head to Phantom Ship Overlook is CLOSED. The road to Cloudcap is also closed.', 'Major road construction on the East Rim Drive near Mount Scott makes it unsafe to hike or bike to the trailhead on the closed road. Once construction moves beyond that area later in the summer, the trailhead will reopen.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'North Entrance Road Temporary Closure', 'id': '4AE33EFE-5CD4-475D-9B9D-079326465ED8', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ease Rim Drive Rehabilitation', 'id': '05BCCDA8-57AE-4A45-8C5B-D045D6810624', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['Parking Lot and Surrounding Area Closed for Construction August 26 through September 27.']
description: ["The Park's parking lot, access road, and outdoor classroom will be closed due to construction safety. Visitors can access the Visitor Center via walking the trails through Riverview Point Preserve located next door. Construction begins Monday August 26."]

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['South Rim Road Construction - Expect Delays & Parking Lot Closures', 'Visitor Center Parking Lot Closures August 5-27 -- No Oversized Vehicle Parking', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']
description: ['Gravel road surfaces and alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays, occasionally up to 30) from the park entrance to the visitor center. Tomichi Point CLOSED August 21, possibly other days. Plan ahead for VERY LIMITED PARKING.', 'Road construction at the South Rim Visitor Center parking lot from Aug. 5-21 and Aug. 26-27. Oversized vehicles (trailers, RVs, buses) are PROHIBITED from entering the parking lot. Parking is very limited; short-term parking only at visitor center.', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.']
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: ['Extreme Summer Heat can be Fatal', 'Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Summer temps in the preserve can exceed 120 degrees. Hiking in the middle of the day and or dealing with a vehicle breakdown on a remote road can quickly become a life-threatening emergency. Plan and prepare with water, shade, and stay with your vehicle.', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Hart Mine Road', 'id': '09EAF34E-7380-4129-A04E-4F3AF013E1BD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ivanpah Low Water Crossing Repair', 'id': 'DEC80F3F-5E36-4E09-9DA3-1B74F93163D1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['MP 292 - MP 305 Road Construction', 'MP 276.5 - MP 282 Road Construction', 'MP 261 - MP 276.5 Road Construction', 'MP 238.5 - MP 248 Road Construction', 'MP 229.5 - MP 238.5 Road Construction', 'MP 248 - MP 249 Bridge Construction', 'MP 221.8 - MP 229.5 Bridge Construction', 'MP 64.6 - MP 86.2 Pavement Preservation', 'MP 27.3 - MP 37.6 Pavement Preservation']
description: ['Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs.', 'Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for repaving and infrastructure repair. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for Laurel Fork Bridge replacement. Detour in place from MP 248 (NC 18) to MP 249 (Northwest Trading Post).', 'Road closed to all activity for replacement of 3 bridges. Detour in place via NC 18 to the NC/VA line near milepost 217.3. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant, is available via NC 18.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.', 'Single lane closure possible with reduced speed for paving work. Bicyclists and motorcyclists are advised to find alternative routes while pavement is curing due to hazardous conditions from loose gravel.']

title: ['Single-lane closures on Newfound Gap Road near Gatlinburg', 'Gatlinburg Bypass closed Aug 21-Aug 25', 'Upcoming closure of Clingmans Dome Road the mornings of September 10, 12 and 16', 'Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']
description: ['Construction on Newfound Gap Road between Gatlinburg and Park HQ. Expect delays during lane closures and drive safely in work zones.', 'Bypass closed between Gatlinburg Scenic Overlook and Newfound Gap Road for bridge construction from Wednesday, August 21 at 8 p.m. until Sunday, August 25 at 8 p.m. The overlook and Campbell Lead Road will remain open.', 'To facilitate special educational programs for students at schools in the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians community, the road will be closed at midnight the night before each event and will re-open at 1 p.m.', 'Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']

title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road']
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.']
