title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', "Jeremy's Run Trail from the boundary"]
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.', "The boundary access to Jeremy's Run Trail across private property at State Route 611 is temporarily closed by the landowner. The park trail remains open. Hikers must access Jeremy's Run from Skyline Drive. The park is working to resolve the situation."]
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Red Gate Fire Road', 'id': 'B7AF53DA-FA44-4743-B579-FF81CB68EE33', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', 'id': 'C509E46A-FE91-4AE4-9D13-9ECFEFC2F89D', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Hart Mine Road', 'id': '09EAF34E-7380-4129-A04E-4F3AF013E1BD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ivanpah Low Water Crossing Repair', 'id': 'DEC80F3F-5E36-4E09-9DA3-1B74F93163D1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Yarborough Pass is temporarily closed']
description: ['Yarborough Pass is temporarily closed due to excessive amounts of standing water on the road. All other park roads remain open.']

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['Seasonal Canyon Closures']
description: ['The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']
description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]
Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site

title: ['Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']
Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Main Park Roads Open to Vehicular Traffic Starting March 10', 'County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion']
description: ['Beginning Sunday, March 10th, 2024, main park roads will be open to vehicular traffic from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.', 'Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.']

title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']
Park Full Name: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Impassable Washout on Sebeois Connector Road']
description: ['There is an impassable washout on the Seboeis Connector Road (46.07214,-68.63190) within the Seboeis Parcel of Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument.']
Park Full Name: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Temporary Trail Closure During Ongoing Storm Recovery']
description: ['NPS work crews continue their work to clear roads and trails of numerous hazardous trees from the weather event on May 26. Due to safety concerns, numerous trails are temporarily closed to pedestrian, bike, and horse traffic due to extensive tree damage.']
Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: ['Trail Closures on Battle Road Trail', 'Trail Closures in place to allow for trail improvements']
description: ['Battle Road Trail between Olive Stow Boardwalk to Brooks Village is closed until Summer of 2024. This will allow for the completion of a trail re-route. Entering closures is prohibited. Please plan accordingly.', 'Rolling Trail Closures and Parking Lot Closures on Battle Road Trail and at the North Bridge Trail will occur in the spring, summer and fall of 2024. Entering closures is prohibited.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may not stop or exit their vehicle in this area. Area south of dunes drive closed to all traffic.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ["Bridge to Thompson's Boat Center is closed"]
description: ["The bridge between the parking lot and Thompson's Boat Center in Georgetown is closed to all vehicles. The bridge's sidewalk is open to pedestrians."]

title: ['Main Road Status']
description: ['The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.']

title: ['Franklin Canyon Park is Open.']
description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is open at the north (Mulholland) entrance to pedestrian and bicycle access only. No vehicular access until further notice due to hazardous conditions. South entrance is open to vehicles. No through traffic.']
Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Montezuma Castle National Monument and its Sub-Unit Montezuma Well. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Pavement Preservation']
description: ['A rolling closure of Lakeshore parking lots and roads will occur in May and June for pavement preservation and resurfacing.']

title: ['Road repairs may occur 4/29 to 8/1; brief delays & some closures expected', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect']
description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Arches' paved park road this summer. Visitors may encounter brief delays and reduced availability in or limited closures of some parking lots.", 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1 or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.']

title: ['Denali Park Road Information', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 15 (Savage River) for personal vehicles. Vehicle travel beyond Savage River in summer is mainly limited to transit and tour buses.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']
description: ["Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River."]

title: ['Infrastructure Projects to Cause Closures and Disruptions']
description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.']

title: ['Visit Safely in the Summer', 'Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ['Summer season brings hot temperatures and monsoons. Bring water, snacks, and sun protection for your visit. Check weather conditions before hiking. Severe lighting and flash floods can occur. When driving in the area, avoid flooded roadways.', 'There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024']
description: ['Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['2024 Off Road Vehicle Closure Order']
description: ['All Off-Road Vehicle Trails will be temporarily closed for recreational access from Monday, June 3rd until Friday, August 2nd. Please click the link to view the official closure order.']

title: ['CENTRAL VA – PARKING LOT CLOSURE– ROUTE 311/MCAFEE KNOB']
description: ['McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2024']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road & shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will be closed for construction from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 9 am (except holidays) during the summer 2024 season. The road also closes Fridays starting September 15.']

title: ['Parking Lot and Surrounding Area CLosed for Construction July 8 through August 28.']
description: ["The Park's parking lot, access road, and surrounding areas will be closed. All visitor access will be prohibited due to construction safety. Visitors will gain access to visitor center and trails through Riverview Point Preserve located next door."]

title: ['Morristown road closures beginning 29 February', 'Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ['On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Hiking trails inaccessible']
description: ['While visitors can drive through the park along State Route 148 and visit the overlooks, all hiking trails continue to be inaccessible due to snow levels.']

title: ['Resurfacing Rim Rock Drive']
description: ['Project work runs from 4/2 - 8/5. There will be delays of up to 15 minutes and temporary road closures between DS Rd and Independence Monument View. Visit the project page for a full work schedule.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Towpath Trail north of Station Road Bridge Trailhead', 'Towpath Trail Temporary Closure']
description: ['Full closure between Station Road Bridge Trailhead and Frazee House. Effective immediately due to a sink hole south of Frazee House.', 'Towpath Trail will be closed for repairs starting at Station Road and extending 2,500 feet north from 7 a.m. and 5 p.m, weekdays. No detour is provided. The anticipated opening date is late January. Towpath will remain open southbound from Station Road.']

title: ['Lassen National Park Highway is CLOSED']
description: ['Lassen National Park Highway connecting the north and south park entrances is CLOSED to through traffic. Spring snow clearing operations are taking place. Vehicles can still access the northwest and the southwest entrances. Learn more.']

title: ['Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.']
description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.', 'GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.']

title: ['Hozomeen Gate Will Remain Closed', 'Cascade River Road Closed for the Winter Season', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['The gate at Hozomeen will remain closed to vehicle access from Canada. Winnebago Flats and the upper Hozomeen campgrounds will remain closed. For more information visit the news release on summer operations.', 'Cascade River Road is closed for the winter season at milepost 20 (El Dorado parking lot), three miles before the trailhead.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The Service Road/Trail from the Lighthouse parking lot toward the lighthouse and the road between the fort and visitor center hills are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']
Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Old East Entrance Station Parking Area', 'South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['The Old East Entrance Station parking area will be temporarily closed to visitor traffic starting Monday, June 17th - Friday, June 28th. Coal Vein Road will be the temporary visitor/vehicle turn-around area.', 'Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Road Construction at Sanford-Yake']
description: ['Roadwork at the Sanford-Yake area will begin on Monday, May 6, 2024. Expect delays.']

title: ['Phleger Estate Miramontes Trail Closed for Public Safety January 2022 Until Trail is Replaced', 'Smith Road Trailhead Parking Lot Temporary Partial Closure April 8 - June 30, 2024', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. Until construction of a re-route is complete, the trail will be closed.', 'Northwest portion of the parking lot off of Bunker Road in Marin Headlands will be temporarily closed. Stay out of the closure and park in the other parking spaces.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Trail Closure']
description: ['Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.']

title: ['LPK Campground Prescribed Fire Operations', 'Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Rx Fire Operations will be conducted within the Long Pine Key (LPK) Campground on Monday June 17, 2024. The LPK campground area will remain closed until operations are completed. Smoke may be present from Main Park Road.', 'Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)']
description: ['Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.']

title: ['Maryland Heights Trail to CLOSE on or about 6/20-6/23/24']
description: ['A geotechnical investigation to improve safety and ensure emergency vehicle access will require a full Maryland Heights trail closure lasting not more than four days. The dates of the work will be updated here as soon as more information is available.']

title: ['Snail Road Beach Access CLOSED']
description: ['Due to nesting shorebirds, the beach access at the end of Snail Road in Provincetown is temporarily closed to the public. Visitors may still walk the trail, but will need to turn around when they reach the closure.']

title: ['South Cut trail Partially Closed']
description: ['South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.']

title: ['Camp only in campgrounds']
description: ['If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Tuzigoot National Monument. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['High to Extreme Fire Danger: Prohibited Activities', 'Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Due to high to extreme fire danger, the following are prohibited: fire, charcoal, and propane grills; smoking except inside personal vehicles; and open flames and cooking stoves in the backcountry. Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center are open.', 'Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Elk With Calves Are Extremely Dangerous', 'Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']
description: ['Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk calves may be hidden close to buildings, under or next to vehicles, and around blind corners. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']

title: ['Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

title: ['Mineral King Road Construction Closures', 'Highway 245 is Closed for Construction and Cannot Be Used to Reach or Leave the Grant Grove Area']
description: ['Temporary daytime closures will be in place on June 25th-28th for road repairs. The Mineral King Road will be fully closed 7:30am-5:00pm with a one-hour travel window at 11:30am. Click more for details.', 'Highway 245 outside the parks is under construction by CalTrans. It is scheduled to be closed through June 30, 2024. It is not possible to reach or leave the Grant Grove area using Highway 245. Alternate routes are available.']

title: ['Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project', 'Dingmans Falls Visitor Center is Closed to RVs, Buses, and Trailers on Weekends and Holidays.']
description: ['Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest is closed for a pavement rehabilitation project. No pedestrian, bicycle, or vehicle traffic is permitted in the closed area. Please see news releases for more information.', 'Due to the heavy volume of traffic and long wait times, the access road to Dingmans Falls Visitor Center is closed to recreational vehicles, buses, and trailers on both weekends and holidays.']
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: ['Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility']
description: ['Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.']
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ["Bandelier's Mandatory Shuttle Runs June 27-October 16, 2024", 'The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Bandelier’s mandatory shuttle service begins on June 27 and will run to October 16. Visitors may drive their private vehicles directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center before 9 am or after 3 pm.', 'Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Grassy Lake Road Closure', 'Teton Pass Closure - Grand Teton Open']
description: ['Grassy Lake Road remains closed due to winter conditions and is scheduled to reopen in mid-June. When open, it is unpaved, making it a difficult and slow route; high clearance and 4WD are recommended. Check link for current road status.', 'Teton Pass (WY 22) which links Victor, ID and Wilson/Jackson, WY is currently closed due to road failure. The closure is expected to last a few weeks as WYDOT constructs a detour. Grand Teton National Park is open. For more information at link below.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Trail Closed at Glebe Road for construction activities']
description: ['The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure of a portion of the Potomac Heritage National Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge during construction activities. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.']

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

title: ['US 212 Closed', 'Climbing Routes Closed for Nesting Falcons']
description: ['US 212 will be closed to all non-local traffic between Crow Agency and Broadus from 6/17 to 6/21. Use alternate routes. All roads within Devils Tower National Monument remain open.', 'North Face climbing routes are closed. Closure effective May 30, 2024. Routes including and between Adrenaline Surfer and Daredevil Index are closed. Ask a rangers for more information and a list of closed routes.']

title: ['Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']
Park Full Name: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine

title: ['Occasional lane closures and traffic delays due to construction at Hwy ZZ & Farm Rd 182']
description: ["Please be advised of potential delays or route obstructions to the Wilson's Creek National Battlefield Entrance from Hwy ZZ starting Monday, September 18th. Entering Wilson's Creek National Battlefield from Farm Road 182 via Battlefield may be faster."]

title: ['Road repairs may occur June through August; brief delays & some closures expected', 'Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays July through September', 'White Rim Road may become impassable at Upheaval Wash', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Canyonlands' paved park roads this summer. Visitors may encounter brief delays and reduced availability in or limited closure of some parking lots.", 'Later this summer, Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles,', 'The White Rim Road can become impassable at Upheaval Wash when the Green River is above 14,000 CFS. Monitor conditions of the river before proceeding with your trip. If the road is flooded and you cannot pass, you must turn around.', 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry with deep ruts. A high clearance vehicle is required.']

title: ['277N Campground Closed to Tentatively Reopen September 1']
description: ['Due to resource theft and damage from unauthorized off-road travel in and around the campground, the 277N Campground is closed. It is expected to reopen September 1, 2024.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.', 'Paradise Road Status: Road open 24 hours, weather dependent.']
description: ['Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.', 'Regular nightly closure of the gate to Paradise at Longmire has ended for the season. The road can still close at any time due to weather/road conditions. All vehicles are still required to carry tire chains until May 1.']

title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]
Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site

title: ['Landing at Hwy 137']
description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

title: ['Route 102A (Seawall Road) in Southwest Harbor is closed to through traffic', 'Significant washouts on Historic Carriage Roads', 'Some Streets in Downtown Bar Harbor Closed for Construction Through Summer']
description: ['Due to storm damage, vehicles must access Seawall Campground, and Wonderland and Ship Harbor trails via the west end of Route 102A (Harbor Drive) in Bass Harbor. Route 102A (Seawall Road) is closed to through traffic at the seawall until further notice.', 'Several areas throughout the carriage road system had significant washouts throughout the winter. Users, especially bicyclists, should use caution and watch for flagged areas.', 'To avoid traffic congestion, visitors should access Sand Beach via the Park Loop Road by following signs from the park’s Hulls Cove entrance on Route 3 (Eden Street) or Cadillac Mountain entrance on Route 233 (Eagle Lake Road) in Bar Harbor.']

title: ['Green River Ferry Status']
description: ['The Green River Ferry Status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed. 2 vehicle limit.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is open to vehicles to Avalanche Campground on the west side of the park and Jackson Glacier Overlook on the east side of the park. The alpine section remains closed.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Portion of Calumet Trail Closed', 'Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail']
description: ['The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. The closure is needed to modernize the trail by raising it and paving it.', 'The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']

title: ['Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road']
description: ['The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.']

title: ['MP 238.5 - MP 248 Single Lane Closure Possible for Road Construction.', 'MP 248 - MP 249 Closed for Bridge Construction', 'Multiple Road Projects Underway']
description: ['Single lane closure possible for road paving and infrastructure repairs. Access to Doughton Park, including the campground and Bluffs Restaurant is available via NC 18.', 'Road closed to all activity for Laurel Fork Bridge replacement. Detour in place from MP 248 (NC 18) to MP 249 (Northwest Trading Post).', 'Road status information with links to project information is updated daily.']

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Tioga Road is closed for the winter']
description: ['Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) is closed for the season due to snow. It usually opens in late May or June.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse', 'Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays']
description: ['Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.', 'Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Hart Mine Road', 'id': '09EAF34E-7380-4129-A04E-4F3AF013E1BD', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Ivanpah Low Water Crossing Repair', 'id': 'DEC80F3F-5E36-4E09-9DA3-1B74F93163D1', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['U.S. Highway 50 Closure', 'US 50 Roadwork - Little Blue Creek Canyon']
description: ['CO Dept. of Transportation has closed U.S. Highway 50 between CR-26 and Red Creek Road (18 to 20 miles west of Gunnison) from mile marker 136 to 138, for bridge work. Check https://www.codot.gov/news/media/overview for updates and alternate routes.', 'One lane will be closed for roadwork with alternating traffic Mondays through Fridays from 8am to 6:30pm. No weekend work is planned. Westbound traffic will experience longer delays between noon and 1pm, so plan accordingly. Wait times will vary.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'US-50 Emergency Closure', 'id': '3CE2C6E6-AA94-4CC1-A155-B9E343D0F71B', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/cure/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Little Blue Creek Canyon Construction', 'id': '3949A0BC-9FC3-483A-892A-52B73482783A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/cure/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Palomarin Road Closure']
description: ['From Wednesday, May 15, 2024, through Wednesday, June 19, 2024, Palomarin Road (and Mesa Road northwest of the Commonweal entrance) will be closed weekdays from 8 am to 5 pm.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Palomarin Road Closure from May 15, 2024, through June 19, 2024', 'id': '8C633E42-1F09-4496-A134-93BA58E226E6', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/pore/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Cades Cove closed Wednesdays to motor vehicles', 'Most visitors need a parking tag', 'Trail Advisory']
description: ['Cades Cove Loop Road is motor vehicle-free all day on Wednesdays from May through September to provide opportunities for cyclists and pedestrians to experience Cades Cove without motor vehicles.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).', 'Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.']

title: ['M-109 Closure - Saturday, June 8 - M-22 Challenge Race', 'Pavement Preservation']
description: ['M-109 will be closed from Welch Road to Day Farm Road from 7:45 am to approximately 11 am. Access to the Dune Climb parking lot will not be available during the race.', 'A rolling closure of Lakeshore parking lots and roads will occur in May and June for pavement preservation and resurfacing.']

title: ['South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Road Construction Update - Delays and Closures in Effect', 'U.S. Highway 50 Closure - East of Black Canyon', 'Highway 50 - Little Blue Creek Canyon Construction', 'Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025']
description: ['Phase one of this major road improvement project is underway with alternating one-way traffic (expect 15-minute delays, multiple stops) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint are closed until at least early June.', 'CO Dept. of Transportation has closed U.S. Highway 50 between CR-26 and Red Creek Road (42 to 44 miles east of Montrose), from mile marker 136 to 138, for bridge work. Check https://www.codot.gov/news/media/overview for updates and alternate routes.', 'Road construction starts May 13, 2024, with alternating one-way closures Mon-Fri 8:00am-6:30pm. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, CO. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated information', 'Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.']
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: ['Additional Closures for June 2024 - Part of Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project', 'Seasonal Canyon Closures']
description: ['6/3 - 6/14: Scenic Drive closed at Gifford Barn. 6/4 - 6/6: Hickman Bridge parking closed for paving and repairs. 6/11: Visitor Center delayed opening of 9 am, Scenic Drive, Gifford House and Panorama Pt. - Goosenecks Road closed.', 'The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.']

title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', "Jeremy's Run Trail from the boundary"]
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.', "The boundary access to Jeremy's Run Trail across private property at State Route 611 is temporarily closed by the landowner. The park trail remains open. Hikers must access Jeremy's Run from Skyline Drive. The park is working to resolve the situation."]

title: ['Most of Rim Drive and North Entrance Road are Currently CLOSED Due to Snow']
description: ['West Rim Drive from Rim Village to Discovery Point (1 mile) is now OPEN for travel. The rest of Rim Drive and North Entrance Road will not reopen until sometime in June or July as plow operators gradually clear sections of large quantities of snow.']

title: ['Scotts Bluff Summit Closure']
description: ['There will be a temporary closure of the Scotts Bluff Summit for invasive species herbicide treatment on June 5th, 6th or 7th. The Summit Road and Saddle Rock Trail may be closed until 10am on any of these days, depending on weather conditions.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road']
description: ['The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.']

title: ['South Cut trail Partially Closed']
description: ['South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024']
description: ['Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.']

title: ['Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']
Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Trail Closed at Glebe Road for construction activities']
description: ['The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure of a portion of the Potomac Heritage National Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge during construction activities. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.']

title: ['Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

title: ['Phleger Estate Miramontes Trail Closed for Public Safety January 2022 Until Trail is Replaced', 'Smith Road Trailhead Parking Lot Temporary Partial Closure April 8 - June 30, 2024', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. Until construction of a re-route is complete, the trail will be closed.', 'Northwest portion of the parking lot off of Bunker Road in Marin Headlands will be temporarily closed. Stay out of the closure and park in the other parking spaces.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: ['Climbing Routes Closed for Nesting Falcons']
description: ['North Face climbing routes are closed. Closure effective May 30, 2024. Routes including and between Adrenaline Surfer and Daredevil Index are closed. Ask a rangers for more information and a list of closed routes.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures', 'The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.', 'The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']
Park Full Name: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site

title: ['Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.', 'Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.']
description: ['Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.', 'GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.']

title: ['Lassen National Park Highway is CLOSED']
description: ['Lassen National Park Highway connecting the north and south park entrances is CLOSED to through traffic. Spring snow clearing operations are taking place. Vehicles can still access the northwest and the southwest entrances. Learn more.']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may not stop or exit their vehicle in this area. Area south of dunes drive closed to all traffic.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Portion of Calumet Trail Closed', 'Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail']
description: ['The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. The closure is needed to modernize the trail by raising it and paving it.', 'The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['2024 Off Road Vehicle Closure Order']
description: ['All Off-Road Vehicle Trails will be temporarily closed for recreational access from Monday, June 3rd until Friday, August 2nd. Please click the link to view the official closure order.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures', 'The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.', 'The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail']
description: ['Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.']
Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

title: ['High to Extreme Fire Danger: Prohibited Activities', 'Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Due to high to extreme fire danger, the following are prohibited: fire, charcoal, and propane grills; smoking except inside personal vehicles; and open flames and cooking stoves in the backcountry. Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center are open.', 'Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Main Road Status']
description: ['The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.']

title: ['Summer 2024 Shuttles Dates Not Yet Announced', 'The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Shuttle dates for 2024 have not been announced yet. Visitors may drive their private vehicles directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center. To avoid parking issues, arrive earlier in the day or later in the afternoon. The park is open from dawn to dusk.', 'Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

title: ['Temporary Trail Closure During Ongoing Storm Recovery']
description: ['NPS work crews continue their work to clear roads and trails of numerous hazardous trees from the weather event on May 26. Due to safety concerns, numerous trails are temporarily closed to pedestrian, bike, and horse traffic due to extensive tree damage.']
Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: ['Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.', 'Paradise Road Status: Road open 24 hours, weather dependent.']
description: ['Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.', 'Regular nightly closure of the gate to Paradise at Longmire has ended for the season. The road can still close at any time due to weather/road conditions. All vehicles are still required to carry tire chains until May 1.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry with deep ruts. A high clearance vehicle is required.']

title: ['Temporary Closure for Prescribed Fire Operations', 'Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Beginning June 4, LPK Road, LPK Day Use, LPK Trail and 3 in 1 Trail will be closed due to prescribed fire activity. Area will reopen when deemed safe by fire managers', 'Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Road repairs may occur 4/29 to 8/1; brief delays & some closures expected', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect']
description: ["Crews will perform crack sealing and similar minor repairs on Arches' paved park road this summer. Visitors may encounter brief delays and reduced availability in or limited closures of some parking lots.", 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1 or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.']

title: ['Visit Safely in the Summer', 'Highway Road Construction Outside Monument', 'Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ['Summer season brings hot temperatures and monsoons. Bring water, snacks, and sun protection for your visit. Check weather conditions before hiking. Severe lighting and flash floods can occur. When driving in the area, avoid flooded roadways.', 'There will be construction on the four-mile section of highway outside of the park entrance until August 19, 2024. There may be periods of brief delay when entering or exiting the park.', "Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility']
description: ['Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.']
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: ['Expect heavy holiday traffic', 'Camp only in campgrounds']
description: ['When parking in Zion is full, we may limit vehicle entry at the south (near Springdale) and east (near Mt. Carmel Jct) vehicle entrance station. There may also be long lines at entrance stations, visitor centers, restrooms, and at trailheads.', 'If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']
description: ["Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River."]

title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]
Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site

title: ['Denali Park Road Information', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 15 (Savage River) for personal vehicles. Vehicle travel beyond Savage River in summer is mainly limited to transit and tour buses.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['Morristown road closures beginning 29 February', 'Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ['On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.', "Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['Hiking trails inaccessible']
description: ['While visitors can drive through the park along State Route 148 and visit the overlooks, all hiking trails continue to be inaccessible due to snow levels.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

title: ['Franklin Canyon Park is Open.']
description: ['Franklin Canyon Park is open at the north (Mulholland) entrance to pedestrian and bicycle access only. No vehicular access until further notice due to hazardous conditions. South entrance is open to vehicles. No through traffic.']
Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

title: ['Grand View Point closing for construction weekdays July through September', 'White Rim Road may become impassable at Upheaval Wash', 'Seasonal climbing closures in effect', 'Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ['Later this summer, Grand View Point Overlook, Grand View Point Trail, and 0.3 mi (0.5 km) of park road will close 6 am Mondays to 4 pm Thursdays for a total of eight weeks. The closure applies to all uses, including vehicles, tour buses, motorcycles,', 'The White Rim Road can become impassable at Upheaval Wash when the Green River is above 14,000 CFS. Monitor conditions of the river before proceeding with your trip. If the road is flooded and you cannot pass, you must turn around.', 'All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.', 'Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Infrastructure Projects to Cause Closures and Disruptions']
description: ['Visitors should expect disruptions to their experience at the park this year due to a number of major infrastructure projects involving intermittent closures to campgrounds, roads, and trailheads, For more information, click "More" or call 775-234-7331.']

title: ['Landing at Hwy 137']
description: ['The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing']

title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]
Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site

title: ['Elk With Calves Are Extremely Dangerous', 'Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed']
description: ['Be alert, especially this time of year around Mammoth Hot Springs. Elk calves may be hidden close to buildings, under or next to vehicles, and around blind corners. You must remain at least 25 yards from all wildlife. If an elk charges, retreat!', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']

title: ['6/5 CONSTRUCTION AT PEDESTRIAN BEACH CROSSING']
description: ['Expected up to a 15 minute delay on 6/5 from 7:30 AM to 2:00 PM at the pedestrian beach crossing between MM 41 and MM 42 on the backroad on South Core Banks.']

title: ['Trail Closure']
description: ['Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.']

title: ['RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)']
description: ['Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is open to vehicles to Avalanche Campground on the west side of the park and Jackson Glacier Overlook on the east side of the park. The alpine section remains closed.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']
description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['CENTRAL VA – PARKING LOT CLOSURE– ROUTE 311/MCAFEE KNOB']
description: ['McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.']

title: ['Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest will be closed for the 2024 summer season for a pavement rehabilitation project. Please see news releases for more information.']
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Occasional lane closures and traffic delays due to construction at Hwy ZZ & Farm Rd 182']
description: ["Please be advised of potential delays or route obstructions to the Wilson's Creek National Battlefield Entrance from Hwy ZZ starting Monday, September 18th. Entering Wilson's Creek National Battlefield from Farm Road 182 via Battlefield may be faster."]
